thread.title: IMF's Lagarde says Greece must reform before getting debt relief
thread.title_full: IMF's Lagarde says Greece must reform before getting debt relief

title: IMF's Lagarde says Greece must reform before getting debt relief
text:
You have successfully emailed the post. IMF's Lagarde says Greece must reform before getting debt relief Jul. 1, 2015, 4:51 PM 3 print 
Thomson Reuters Greek Finance Minister Varoufakis listens to IMF Managing Director Lagarde during an euro zone finance ministers meeting in Luxembourg 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The head of the International Monetary Fund on Wednesday suggested that Greece should move to reform its economy before its European creditors give it a break on its debt. 
In an interview with Reuters, IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde was asked which should come first, commitments to reform by Athens or relief on its debts from euro zone governments. 
"Given where we are, my suspicion is it would be much preferable to see a deliberate move towards reforms (and) for that to be followed through by the other side of the balance," Lagarde said. 
(Reporting by Anna Yukhananov; Editing by Leslie Adler) Read the original article on Reuters . Copyright 2015. Follow Reuters on Twitter . More from Reuters:
